column1: 0650|six fifty|That night I lay in my jangling single bed across from Sammy’s and I watched him sleep
column2: and then I stared at the ceiling. I got up and took a blanket and went and made a cup of tea
column3: and lay on the sofa and tried to read one of the wrinkled paperbacks. I blinked my way through a hallucinatory half chapter
column4: set it aside and closed my eyes. I woke and it was six fifty
column5: and I winced my way upstairs and lay down in my bed
column6: to be there when Sammy woke up again.

column3: was coming from Boston on the six-fifty train - the dawn train
column4: the only train that still stopped in the small Ohio city where I lived.
